title: Understanding IF-THEN-ELSE
text: The IF-THEN-ELSE statement is a control flow statement often used in programming and SQL queries to execute different blocks of code or actions depending on whether a certain condition is true or false.

title: Importance of ELSE
text: The ELSE part of the IF-THEN-ELSE statement is crucial as it catches any cases not already handled by specific IF conditions. Think of it as a safety net for unaddressed possibilities.

hintAnswer: It is the ELSE action, performed when neither 'if it rains' nor 'if it snows' conditions are true.
title: Creating a Simple IF-THEN-ELSE Flow
text: Imagine a situation: If it rains, we'll stay indoors. If it snows, we'll make a snowman. Otherwise, we'll go on a picnic. What is the role of 'Otherwise, we'll go on a picnic' in this scenario?
choices: It is the ELSE action, performed when neither 'if it rains' nor 'if it snows' conditions are true.
It is an IF condition for a picnic
It is not a part of the $$IF-THEN-ELSE$$ structure
It acts as an alternate IF condition for no condition
